snippet: Despite his mother’s efforts, Matt Shaw, 21, who planned to attend graduate school in the fall, was killed on July 4 in what prosecutors describe as a case of mistaken identity.
abstract: Paula Shaw-Leary of East Harlem lost her 21-year-old son Matt Shaw on July 4, when he was shot and killed in a case of mistaken identity; she expresses hope that residents and politicians from New York City's African-American neighborhoods will join leaders like Mayor Michael R Bloomberg and Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly in their efforts to get guns off the streets.
lead_paragraph: Despite his mother’s efforts, Matt Shaw, 21, who planned to attend graduate school in the fall, was killed on July 4 in what prosecutors describe as a case of mistaken identity.

headline.seo: Young College Graduate Killed in Harlem
headline.main: Mother’s Precautions Finally Fail, 2 Blocks From Home
headline.print_headline: Mother’s Precautions Finally Fail, 2 Blocks From Home
